p: Wuhan, the capital of Hubei Province and the largest city in central China, is located in the middle of the Yangtze River Delta, at 29°58´–31°22´ north latitude and 113°41´–115°05´ east longitude. Wuhan has typical subtropical, humid, monsoon climate with a distinct pattern of four seasons. Jiang’an District is one of the seven main central urban districts in Wuhan and was the political, economic, cultural, financial, and information center of Wuhan City. The resident population of Jiang’an District was about 0.68 million in 2010 and urban area was 64.24 km 2. Known as an oven city in China, Wuhan usually experienced very hot summers, with the highest maximum temperature of 39.6 °C during 2003–2010.
